item.title: Buddy Goes West
item.description: Buddy goes West is a 1981 Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Michele Lupo.

item.title: Johnny Oro
item.description: Ringo and His Golden Pistol is a 1966 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Sergio Corbucci and starring Mark Damon.

item.title: Adiós, Sabata
item.description: Adiós, Sabata is a 1970 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Gianfranco Parolini. It is the second film in The Sabata Trilogy by Parolini. Yul Brynner takes over the lead role from Lee Van Cleef, who stars in the first and third films.

item.title: Drummer of Vengeance
item.description: Drummer of Vengeance is a 1971 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Mario Gariazzo and starring Ty Hardin, Rossano Brazzi and Craig Hill.

item.title: Man of the East
item.description: Man of the East is a 1972 Italian spaghetti western film directed by Enzo Barboni starring Terence Hill.

item.title: Gli uomini dal passo pesante
item.description: The Tramplers is a 1965 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Albert Band and Mario Sequi based on the novel Guns of North Texas by Will Cook.

item.title: Kill Them All and Come Back Alone
item.description: Kill Them All and Come Back Alone is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Enzo G. Castellari. It stars American actors Chuck Connors and Frank Wolff, and features a film score by Francesco De Masi.

item.title: Bury Them Deep
item.description: Bury Them Deep is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film written and directed by Paolo Moffa and starring Craig Hill.

item.title: Gunman Sent by God
item.description: Gunman Sent by God is a 1968 Italian Spaghetti Western film directed by Giorgio Ferroni and starring Anthony Steffen.

item.title: Life Is Tough
item.description: Life Is Tough, Eh Providence? is a 1972 Italian-Spanish Spaghetti Western comedy film directed by Giulio Petroni. The film was a box office success and generated an immediate sequel, Here We Go Again, Eh Providence?.
